Due to the impact of COVID-19, the MHSAA has changed their requirements for this school year only. If your student had a physical for the 2019-2020 school year, the returning student-athletes and a parent/guardian will need to fill out and turn in the 2020-21 MHSAA SPORTS HEALTH QUESTIONNAIRE. If the student does not have any underlying conditions, and they have a valid sports physical on file, the student will not be required to have a new physical for the entire 2020-2021 school year.

For any students new to school sponsored sports, they will be required to have a new sports physical which cannot have been completed prior to April 15, 2020. Under certain circumstances, the district may require a student to obtain a new physical.

The MHSAA has created an FAQ page to answer general questions. If you have additional questions, please contact our Athletic Director, Perry Deliyanne, at perry.deliyanne@hanoverhorton.org.

During a press conference late tonight, Governor Whitmer ordered the closure of all Michigan schools beginning Monday, March 16th. The plan is to reopen on Monday, April 6th. We will have a full day of school on Friday, March 13th. All activities will be cancelled during the mandatory closure.

The attached press release is all of the information that we have at this time. Once we receive additional information, we will send you any necessary updates.

As always, if you have any questions, please inbox the Facebook page, email me at john.denney@hanoverhorton.org or call 517-563-0100.

Thank you! John Denney, Superintendent
